attributes.action: Make the CSA accountable for incorrect assessments and owe a duty of care to both parents
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The CSA owes no one a duty of care. So every time they make an error in an assessment no compensation for costs or interest or damages consequential or otherwise are available.
Currently the lower courts have no jurisdiction over the CSA or Sec of State. this should change so the CSA are responsible for their assessments and actions and individuals can recover costs and damages
The only redress is to the High Court or European Court of Human rights.
A change in the legislation is urgently required.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
